intro: Stenomesson herbertianum, commonly known as Herbert's morning glory, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a member of the Convolvulaceae family, which includes many vines and climbing plants. The plant produces showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that are typically pale blue to lavender in color. Its leaves are heart-shaped and covered in fine, silky hairs. Stenomesson herbertianum is often found in moist, sunny habitats such as meadows and along stream banks.
